intro: Lessingia nemaclada var. albiflora, commonly known as the whiteflower lessingia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as sandy soils and rocky areas. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, with five petals that open in the morning. This variety is distinguished by its pale floral coloration, which sets it apart from other varieties of Lessingia nemaclada.
